name: elver
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a young eel (= a long, thin, snake-like fish): Elvers were traditionally eaten by local people and have been netted in the Severn for hundreds of years.
Rodger Jackman/Oxford Scientific/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examples All the countless millions of elvers on the move are driven by the urge to find freshwater. Billy tipped the elvers into his bucket.Rod not only sells cod and haddock but also elvers from Spain and caviar from the Caspian Sea. They waited with their elver nets, scooping the waters.
